chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Lee Vance was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andre Lee Vance is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andre Lee Vance was found guilty of Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Consecutive to Rock County Case #13CF1764 and Dane County Case #13CF1856.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: to Rock Co. #13CF1764 & Dane Co. #13CF1856

superMiscConds.notes:
$2873.68 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF231.
Joint and Several with co-defendants.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF231.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to  be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF231.

-Comply with risk and needs assessment and any other screening tools by the DOC.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Participate in and successfully complete CGIP as recommended.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and DOC.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license, valid insurance and prior Agent's approval.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

records.addlTxt:
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Andre Lee Vance appeared from jail. Case called at 10:09 a.m. Atty Smestad has a correction on PSI on defendant's fathers name otherwise in agreement of the report and no other corrections. ADA Nieskes gives recommendations. Restitution in the amount of $12,696.81 total. Defendant does not object to the money owed to victim but does object to the amount owed to Western Mutual Insurance. State is in compliance to victims rights. Atty Smestad gives argument. Is challenging the amount owed to Western Mutual Insurance. Court reviews file, PSI, letter from victim and informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties. Defendant makes statement. Has 20 days to file an appeal. Defendant waives appearance for restitution hearing. Court orders:

- Bifercated sentence of 4 years  

- 1 year initial confinement,  3 years ES

- Consecutive to underlying sentences. Rock Co . 13CF1764 and Dane Co. 13CF1856

- Comply with risk and needs assessment and any other screening tools by the department

- Pay court costs, supervision fees and restitution 

- DNA Sample and Surcharge

- Maintain full time employment

- Participate in and successfully complete CGIP as recommended

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

- Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse

-  Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- Resitution Joint and Several with co-defendants. Authorize department to apply defendant's earnings go to victim first. Orders Restitution in the amount of $2,873.68 to Mr. Croes. Restitution hearing will be held on the remaining amount
 
- Not to operate any motor vehicle without prior agent's approval, a valid driver's license and valid insurance

- Cooperate with any rules and conditions established by the DOC
from Victim. eif
Filed by Victim Witness Office. Re: attached letter and restitution worksheet. km
Sentencing hearing at 09-18-2015 10:00 am
Sentencing hearing at 09-18-2015 10:00 am
filed by Agent Kerry Lenzendorf. eif              w/file to RMW
faxed to probation. cc: DA and Atty
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
Sentencing hearing at 09-18-2015 01:00 pm

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Andre Lee Vance appeared from jail. Case called at 3:51 p.m. Atty Smestad states there is an agreement and ready for plea today. ADA Nieskes gives recommendations. Victim rights have been complied with. Will need a restitution hearing set. Not requesting a PSI. Atty Smestad willing to waive PSI. ADA Nieskes recommending set for a status/sentencing and acquire the previous PSI ordered in his other out of county case. State will prepare an order to acquire a copy of the PSI.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 15CF231  . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF231 . On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct  2 in 15CF231 and read in for restitution purposes . ADA Nieskes after reviewing CCAP, does not find a previous PSI was ordered in the Dane Co or Rock Co cases. Court orders a PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
